PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Agfa Superpan Supreme safety film
CatDescriptText: image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 16, 1941, pg. 2, reads: "Buddy, Rochester are Pals - Perhaps the proudest youngster in East End this morning is Phidias (Buddy) Chronis, 7-year-old son of Mr. and Mrs. George Chronis of Frankstown avenue. The talented youngster is one of the Pittsburgh 'pals' of Eddie 'Rochester' Anderson, famous radio and screen luminary.  The above picture was snapped to during the film star's recent engagement at Pittsburgh's Stanley Theatre. - Harris photo."A sign on the wall in background reads: "Please do not invite your guests to stand in the wings or on stage during performances, stage must be clear at all times, kindly cooperate, thanks".
TitMainTitle: Eddie "Rochester" Anderson wearing boater hat and cigar in mouth, posed with arm around Phidias "Buddy" Chronis, at Stanley Theatre
